abstract: Return the list of network interfaces managed by the Hotspot Helper infrastructure.
overview:
## Return Value

If no network interfaces are being managed, this function returns nil. Otherwise, an array of `NEHotspotNetwork` objects is returned.

## Discussion

Each network interface is represented by an NEHotspotNetwork object. Currently, the returned array contains exactly one [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotNetwork] object representing the Wi-Fi interface.

The main purpose of this method is to allow a Hotspot Helper to provide accurate status in its UI at times when it has not been given a command to process. This method coupled with the `isChosenHelper` method of [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotNetwork] allows the application to know whether it is the one that is handling the current network.

# supportedNetworkInterfaces()

**Type Method**

Return the list of network interfaces managed by the Hotspot Helper infrastructure.

## Declaration

```swift
class func supportedNetworkInterfaces() -> [Any]?
```

## Return Value

If no network interfaces are being managed, this function returns nil. Otherwise, an array of `NEHotspotNetwork` objects is returned.

## Discussion

Each network interface is represented by an NEHotspotNetwork object. Currently, the returned array contains exactly one [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotNetwork] object representing the Wi-Fi interface.

The main purpose of this method is to allow a Hotspot Helper to provide accurate status in its UI at times when it has not been given a command to process. This method coupled with the `isChosenHelper` method of [doc://com.apple.networkextension/documentation/NetworkExtension/NEHotspotNetwork] allows the application to know whether it is the one that is handling the current network.
title: supportedNetworkInterfaces()
